Easy: The cat is sleeping on the chair.
I like to eat apples and bananas.
She is reading a book in the room.
The sun is shining brightly today.
He is running fast to catch the bus.
We are learning typing in class.
The dog is playing in the garden.
My phone is on the table.
The clock shows it is time for lunch.
Medium: The software needs to be tested before release.
An algorithm can solve complex problems quickly.
The network connection was interrupted yesterday.
We analyzed the document carefully for errors.
The function calculates the total price automatically.
Optimization improves the performance of the system.
She compiled the code and ran it successfully.
The variable stores the user input value.
During debugging, he found a hidden bug.
The class inherits properties from its parent class.
Hard: Asynchronous operations allow multiple tasks to run concurrently.
Polymorphism enables objects to take many forms in programming.
Encapsulation protects data by restricting direct access to variables.
Abstraction hides complex implementation details from the user.
The interface defines the structure of classes and methods.
Implementation of advanced algorithms improves application efficiency.
Virtual methods can be overridden by derived classes.
The callback function executes after the asynchronous request completes.
Event listeners monitor user actions such as clicks or key presses.
Accessibility ensures that applications are usable by everyone, including screen readers.
